articles.title: Austrian Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Austrian Delegation Arrives 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Austrian Center for International Studies led by Director Frances Mavtner-Markhof arrived here Saturday.

articles.title: Mongolian Parliamentary Delegation Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Mongolian Parliamentary Delegation Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the State Great Hural of Mongolia led by Vice-Chairman R. Gonchigdorj visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 Members of the delegation paid tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state the visitors paid homage to them.
					
					 They looked round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The head of the delegation made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation, Its Players Meet
articles.content:
DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation, Its Players Meet
 Inchon, September 27 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Members of the delegation of the DPRK Olympic Committee and the DPRK's players group taking part in  the 17th Asian Games held a meeting "Evening longing for respected Marshal Kim Jong Un" in Inchon, south Korea on Saturday. 
					 Kim Yong Hun, chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee and minister of Physical Culture and Sports, is heading the delegation.
					
					 At the meeting the minister said not many days they spent in the south away from the care of the Marshal, but  the minds of all members of the delegation and players are running to him whom they long to see, awake or asleep.
					
					 Heard from the venue of the meeting was loud song "Warm Feelings" reflecting the single-minded unity of the service personnel and people of the DPRK linked with the unbreakable blood ties with the Marshal.
					
					 Player Kim Un Guk recited his own poem "Dear Comrade Kim Jong Un", mesmerizing the participants.
					
					 Player Kim Hyok Bong told them how he grew up to be a sportsman of Songun Korea, having his hope and skill given full play under the loving care of the great father. Led by him, the participants sang song "We Cannot Live without You".
					
					 Kim Il, secretary general of the Korean Wrestling Association, called upon all players to glorify the country with gold medals at the games with the courage and pluck of the Marshal, the banner of victory and glory.
					
					 Kim Pyong Sik, head of the players group, underlined the need for all players to grab more gold medals at the games while loudly singing song "Ardent Desire" and to make a report of loyalty to the Marshal.
					
					 Deputy head of the players group Sin Yong Chol ardently called for flying the DPRK flags at venues of games, bearing in mind that the country and its people are watching the players.

articles.title: DPRK Sportsmen Bag Gold Medals at 17th Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Sportsmen Bag Gold Medals at 17th Asian Games
						
 Inchon, September 27 (KCNA Correspondent) -- DPRK sportsmen Jong Hak Jin and Kim Ji Song on Saturday placed first respectively in the 57kg category of the men's freestyle wrestling and in the men's individual mixed 10m running target of the 17th Asian Games.
					 Wrestler Jong Hak Jin defeated its Mongolian rival 11-8 in the preliminaries, its Japanese rival 4-2 in the semifinals, and its Kazakh rival 8-6 in the finals, grabbing a gold.
					
					 Kim Ji Song scored 96 points in the first round, 98 points in the second round, 95 points in the third and fourth rounds respectively, finishing the first with the total points of 384.
					
					 On the same day DPRK players came second in the men's team mixed 10m running target.

articles.title: Samjiyon Band of Mansudae Art Troupe Begins Performance
articles.content:
Samjiyon Band of Mansudae Art Troupe Begins Performance
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe began performance at the Rungna People's Pleasure Park here on Sunday in the wake of performances by the National Circus. 
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including mixed vocal sextet "Ode to the Motherland", male solo "Our Future Is Bright", mixed quartet "Song of a Girl" and female solo "Let Us Live for Future". 
					
					 Music for violin "Our Father", female solo "Expression of My Inmost Feelings", etc. deeply impressed the audience as they expressed boundless reverence for supreme leader Kim Jong Un and ardent will of the Korean people to be invariably loyal to his leadership. 
					
					 "Song of Big Fish Haul", "Sea of Apples at Foot of Chol Pass" and other folk songs pleased the audience as they represented the breath of the stirring times featured by new legend of love for the people. 
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience. 
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Papers Accuse Park Geun Hye of Her Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
articles.content:
Papers Accuse Park Geun Hye of Her Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye of south Korea, in a "keynote speech" at the UN General Assembly session fully revealed once again her ugly colors as a wicked woman living under the patronage of foreign forces and a traitor staking her fate on confrontation with fellow countrymen, say papers Sunday in commentaries.
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that at the UN arena Park unhesitatingly let loose a spate of extremely reckless remarks against the DPRK, Rodong Sinmun notes, and goes on:
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula was spawned due to the DPRK-targeted nuclear war moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces kowtowing to it.
					
					 Feigning ignorance of the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threat to the DPRK, Park jabbered that the DPRK's nuclear deterrence to cope with them is a "threat". This is sheer sophism which cannot convince anyone and does not stand to reason.
					
					 "Economic support" to the DPRK touted by Park makes it not hard to guess that she is a megalomaniac totally unable to face up to the reality.
					
					 Ridiculous, indeed, is her ballyhooing about support to someone as south Korea is torn with people's grievances owing to political confusion, economic crisis and deterioration of people's living.
					
					 Park made reckless remarks hurting the dignity and the social system of the DPRK over its "human rights" issue. This is an open declaration that she would strongly oppose any process for improving the north-south relations and escalate confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that she uttered that "unification of Germany is a cornerstone of new Europe" and the unification sought by her "would serve as a cornerstone of new Northeast Asia." Herein lie her ulterior, cunning and crafty intention and ambition for achieving the unification of social systems.
					
					 If the south Korean puppet forces persist in the moves for escalating the confrontation with the DPRK with the backing of foreign forces, it will only entail the miserable consequences precipitating their self-destruction.
					
					 Minju Joson says: It is the first time that the south Korean puppet president let loose a flurry of invectives against the DPRK over its nuclear issue and "human rights" issue at the UN General Assembly session. This is an unpardonable treacherous act of declaring all-out confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Air Force to Take Part in Dangerous Saber-rattling in U.S.
articles.content:
S. Korean Air Force to Take Part in Dangerous Saber-rattling in U.S.
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet air force is planning to take part in the Red Flag joint military exercises to be staged by the Command of the U.S. Air in the Pacific in Alaska State, the U.S. from Sept. 29 to Oct. 17, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The exercises, divided into fighters drill and transport drill, will include drills for surprise and preemptive air strike. Drawing attention is the plan for staging the drill for dropping bunker buster.
					
					 This fully reveals the danger of the exercises as ones for making a preemptive air strike at the DPRK's strategic vantages. It also brings to light the black-hearted intention of the south Korean puppet forces to remain servants for the U.S. imperialists' war.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are going to prove their sycophancy towards the U.S. in practice by planning to send their armed forces to the U.S. to ignite a war against the DPRK.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Reckless Remarks against North under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Reckless Remarks against North under Fire in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- South Korean people from all walks of life are becoming increasingly critical of Park Geun Hye for her malignant mud-slinging at the DPRK in her "keynote speech" at the 69th UN General Assembly. 
					 The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Friday in an editorial said Park Geun Hye's behavior at the UN General Assembly made it harder to settle the issue of the south-north relations. 
					
					 The paper said: The "president" said south Korea together with the international community would provide strong support for developing economy in the north if it gives up its nuclear program and chooses a road of reform and opening-up. This is little short of "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" touted by the Lee Myung Bak regime in the past.
					
					 The Kyunghyang Daily News on the same day accused Park of taking the lead in the propaganda against the north. 
					
					 It is incoherent that Park slandered the north in the international arena, taking no sincere approach towards south-north dialogue, and uttered empty words, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 It is hypocrisy to talk about "support" without lifting the "May 24 measures", in particular. 
					
					 The south-north issue is neither other's one nor something to be done by the international community instead. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the opposition Democratic Alliance for New Politics Friday released a statement urging an immediate stop to the leaflets scattering operations. 
					
					 The leaflets scattering is escalating the tension. 
					
					 The "government" should regard the leaflets scattering operations as dangerous acts of disturbing the peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Stage Frantic War Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Stage Frantic War Exercises
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers staged provocative firepower strike drills targeting the DPRK in different parts  of south Korea on Sept. 26, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The anti-air guided missile command of the puppet air force staged a firepower demonstration drill at the Taechon firing range in Poryong, South Chungchong Province at which it fired various type missiles and artillery pieces.
					
					 The puppet ground force also staged a firepower strike drill with new type tanks and the 20th Division's tanks, armored cars and artillery pieces involved at the combined drill ground in Yangphyong, Kyonggi Province. 
					
					 The warmongers were busy with military exercises for preemptive strike, including mobile and firepower strike drill of self-propelled artillery pieces and armored cars and a firing drill of guided weapons for destroying new type tanks in Phochon and other places.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Jong Suk Observed in Peru
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Jong Suk Observed in Peru
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru and the Peruvian People's Women Union jointly released a special bulletin on September 22, the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The bulletin carried a photo of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and a photo of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The bulletin noted in an article:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, the woman commander of Mt. Paektu, set a noble example in the struggle for defending and implementing the idea and line of President Kim Il Sung and made distinguished contributions to the anti-Japanese armed struggle to defeat the Japanese imperialists and liberate Korea and to the movement for the emancipation of women.
					
					 It is high pride and honor for the Peruvian People's Women Union to register her as its honorary member.
					
					 She together with Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il will be always remembered by mankind.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Portrait of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Portrait of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A bouquet was laid before the portrait of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk with due ceremony in Peru on Sept. 22, the 65th anniversary of her demise.
					 Present at the ceremony were officials and members of the Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru and the Peruvian People's Women Union, the DPRK ambassador to Peru and his embassy officials.
					
					 The international secretary of the Peruvian People's Women Union who doubles as curator of the library said:
					
					 On September 22 every year we look back on the noble life and feats of Kim Jong Suk with yearning and reverence for her.
					
					 She performed undying feats in the struggle for the victory of the Korean revolution and the development of the women's movement.
					
					 In order to convey long her feats, we registered her as an honorary member of the Peruvian People's Women Union and made the library go by her august name.
					
					 We will always remember her and learn from her noble example and wage a positive struggle to achieve the socialist cause and strengthen the women's movement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Praised by British Organization
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association UK released a statement on Sept. 22, the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We remember with deep emotion Kim Jong Suk, mother of Korea and anti-Japanese war hero, on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of her demise.
					
					 She was an indomitable revolutionary fighter who performed distinguished exploits in the armed struggle to liberate Korea from the yoke of Japanese imperialism and in the building of new democratic Korea and a pioneer of the Juche-based Korean women's movement.
					
					 She made a great contribution to building the revolutionary armed forces in new Korea.
					
					 Though she passed away, her great life dedicated to the Korean revolution and people will always be remembered not only by the Korean people but by the world progressives.
